post_text:
Greetings to all! This will be my last post to this page. I hope that we are able to transfer its information and contents to others so that you may continue to enjoy the history of Hillsboro High School.

I have accepted a position with the Cleburne ISD and will start my new position with them on July 1. It has been my great pleasure to maintain this page for you.

"Doc" Robertson

shared_text:
Hillsboro High School Military Honors added a new photo.
January 11, 2019 at 11:58 AM ·

John Wiley "Dub" Galiga

United States Army Air Corp
352nd Fighter Group, 328th Fighter Squadron
Rank: 1st Lieutenant

Killed in Action - July 18, 1944
1st Lieutenant “Dub” Galiga was Killed in Action when his North American P-51B-10 (SN: 43-7165) “Lady Lynn” was shot down by a Bf 109G-6 flown by Uffz Wiebenscher of ZG 26/2 over Parchim, Germany on July 18, 1944. He was credited with two confirmed kills.

Photo Courtesy: Cathy Mackey

post_text: Always on the lookout for more photos....if you are someone you know of attended Hillsboro High School in Hillsboro, Texas......drop me a note and we will try to get those photos on this site and on our Wall of Honor at HHS.

post_text: I hope that you are enjoying the photos of our alumni that served, or are currently serving, our country. I strive for accuracy. If I am incorrect with any of my information, please contact me. I have many names of individuals that I do not have photos of. If you are aware of an HHS/Peabody graduate that you do not see, let me know. Email me at robertson@hillsboroisd.org
